questions.text: Which statement is incorrect about amino acid shown in the image below:

options.label: A
options.text: It is an essential and alpha-amino acid. It is a proteinogenic amino acid

options.label: B
options.text: It contains an indole side chain and thus is a non-polar aromatic amino acid

options.label: C
options.text: It serves as the biochemical precursor of serotonin, niacin, and melatonin

options.label: D
options.text: It contains an imidazole group and thus is a polar aromatic amino acid

questions.correct_answer: D. It contains an imidazole group and thus is a polar aromatic amino acid
questions.explanation:
Solution:

It contains an imidazole group and thus is a polar aromatic amino acid The amino acid shown is Tryptophan which contains an indole side chain. It is a non-polar aromatic amino acid. Imidazole ring is present in proline. Tryptophan is an essential and alpha-amino acid. It is a proteinogenic (present in proteins) amino acid. Tryptophan contains an indole side chain and thus is a non-polar aromatic amino acid. Tryptophan serves as the biochemical precursor of serotonin, niacin, and melatonin. Serotonin is produced through a tryptophan hydroxylase reaction. Melatonin is produced from serotonin through N-acetyltransferase and 5-hydroxyindole-O-methyltransferase enzymes.

questions.text: A 40-year-old male whose brother recently had a heart attack at 45-years-old is worried and visited a physician to consult about the risk of him having a heart attack. The doctor ordered blood tests such as HbA1C, lipid profile, and homocysteine level. The report revealed normal HbA1c but elevated homocysteine levels. These findings suggest that the amino acid that is not metabolized properly in the patient’s blood is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Methionine Methionine is metabolized as shown in the figure: A defect in either the enzyme that forms methionine (methionine synthase) or the enzyme that forms cystathionine (cystathionine ß-synthase) will lead to elevated homocysteine levels. Also, a deficiency of cobalamin and/or folate can also lead to homocysteine accumulation. As this patient has no genetic enzyme deficiencies so the most probable cause of his homocystinuria is a deficiency of vitamins which can be treated by vitamin supplementation. All other amino acids given in the options do not require homocysteine for their synthesis.

questions.text: Which of the following dietary non-essential amino acid becomes dietary essential in patients of Type I homocystinuria?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Cysteine Cysteine is dietarily non-essential since it can be synthesized from the essential amino acid methionine I n Type I homocystinuria, methionine to cysteine conversion is affected So, Cysteine becomes essential in the diet.

questions.text: Tryptophan loading test is done to detect deficiency of:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

PLP Tryptophan loading test detects xanthurenic acid in urine which indicates the deficiency of Vitamin B 6 e. PLP (Pyridoxal phosphate). In the absence of Vitamin B 6 the excess of 3-OH-Kynurenine is converted to Xanthurenic acid after given a load of tryptophan (see Fig below) Tryptophan catabolism pathway Note: Histidine load test detects FIGLU (Form-Imino Glutamate) in urine which indicates the deficiency of Vitamin B 9 table,tr,th,td {border:1px solid black;} Deficiency Common metabolite Specific metabolite Vitamin B6 Homocysteine Xanthurenic acid Vitamin B9 Homocysteine FIGLU Vitamin B12 Homocysteine L-methyl malonic acid

questions.text: Carcinoid tumor cells produce large quantities of 5-hydroxy indoleacetic acid (5-HIAA) with the help of aldehyde dehydrogenase, which is then eliminated in the urine. Which of the following metabolic end product of tryptophan metabolism directly give rise to HIAA:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Serotonin Carcinoid Tumor In carcinoid tumor, too much of serotonin is produced, Hence, HIAA (Hydroxy Indole acetic acid) which is the end product of Serotonin catabolism will be excreted in excess in urine. Also, as a lot of tryptophan is used up for the formation of serotonin tryptophan will not be available for Niacin biosynthesis, so l ess Niacin is formed. Thus, these patients will have Niacin deficiency and Pellagra- like symptoms Due to excess of Serotonin these patients will have Profuse Sweating GI abnormalities like: Abdominal cramps and Diarrhea Cutaneous flushing

questions.text: Assertion: Conversion of homocysteine to methionine requires folate and vitamin B12 as a cofactor, this reaction is a transmethylation process. Reason: The enzyme required for this process is homocysteine methyl transferase which requires methyl group from methylcobalamin. Methylcobalamin in turn, acquires the methyl group from methyl-THF.

options.label: A
options.text: Both Assertion and Reason are independently tru /correct statements and the Reason is the correct explanation for the Assertion

options.label: B
options.text: Both Assertion and Reason are independently true/correct statements, but the Reason is not the correct explanation for the Assertion

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion is independently a true/correct statement, but the Reason is independently a false / incorrect statement

options.label: D
options.text: Assertion is independently a false/incorrect statement, but the Reason is independently a true/correct statement.

questions.correct_answer: A. Both Assertion and Reason are independently tru /correct statements and the Reason is the correct explanation for the Assertion
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Both Assertion and Reason are independently tru /correct statements and the Reason is the correct explanation for the Assertion Deficiency of Vitamin B12 leads to accumulation of N5-methyl THF Free THF becomes deficient ( Folate Trap ). Thymidine monophosphate synthesis requires N5, N10-methylene-THF which is derivatized from free THF Results: This leads to defective DNA synthesis and so megaloblastic anemia So B12 deficiency leads to megaloblastic anemia due to folate trap.

questions.text: Sulfur containing amino acids metabolism needs-
questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above Sulfur containing amino acid metabolism requires three vitamins: Vitamin B6 (Pyridoxine), Vitamin B9 (Folate) Vitamin B12. Folate and vitamin B12 are required for one- carbon transfer and Pyridoxine is required in Cystathionine Synthase , which converts Homocysteine to Cystathionine.

questions.text: Cystinuria is due to a deficiency of the dibasic amino acid transporter in the intestines and kidneys. Cystine is not reabsorbed leading to kidney stones. In Cystinuria, which of the following amino acids will be excreted in urine?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ornithine Cystinuria (cystine-lysinuria): It is one of the most common inherited diseases (it is Autosomal Recessive). Increased excretion of amino acids in urine: Cystine (25-40 times normal) (most common) Lysine Arginine Ornithine In cystinuria, specific carrier system in kidney tubules for the reabsorption of amino acids ( cysteine, ornithine, arginine, and lysine (remember COLA to recall) become defective Most common inborn error of amino acid transport Formation of cystine stones in the kidney and urinary tract Cyanide nitroprusside test positive It’s a Part of Garrod’s tetrad Treatment: Restricted ingestion of dietary cystine high intake of fluids Chelating agent Penicillamine (forms a complex with cysteine)

questions.text: Serotonin is a mono-amine neurotransmitter produced by the decarboxylation of the amino acid tryptophan. Chemically serotonin is which one of following?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

5-hydroxytryptamine (5-HT) Serotonin is synthesized from Tryptophan by hydroxylation & decarboxylation. Extra information: 5-hydroxytryptophan is also known as Oxitriptan. Melatonin is a product of Tryptophan whereas Melanin is a Product of Tyrosine .

questions.text: Atherosclerosis involves the formation of lipid-rich plaques in the intima of arteries which can narrow the coronary arteries, leading to decreased blood flow and hypoxia of cardiac cells. Which of the following amino acid is known to be associated with Atherosclerosis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Homocysteine HOMOCYSTINURIA –Homocysteine accumulation lead to stroke, atherosclerosis, MI, and Pulmonary embolism. Homocysteine binds with the endothelium of the blood vessels and activates signaling pathways which leads to the release of pro-inflammatory molecules. This could result in the following: Extensive atheroma formation at a young age affects many arteries but not the coronary arteries Intravascular thrombosis
